newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Serial System offers 37 mln shares in S'pore IPO.
newsitem.headline: Serial System offers 37 mln shares in S'pore IPO.

text.p: Electronic parts distributor Serial System Pte Ltd said on Tuesday it would offer 37 million shares in its initial public offering (IPO) on Singapore's second board, SESDAQ.

Serial System said in a statement 27.75 million shares would be offered to the public at Singapore $0.58 each. A further 9.25 million shares would be placed privately with institutions at S$0.60 each.
The offer represents 19 percent of the company's enlarged share capital of 187.5 million shares.

Based on the public offer price of S$0.58 each, the historical price earnings (PE) ratio was 13.03 times, it said. Based on the placement price of S$0.60 per share, it was equivalent to a PE ratio of 13.48 times.
The company aims to raise S$12.2 million in net proceeds and the funds will be used to finance expansion and to develop markets in China, South Korea, India and Indonesia.
The IPO will be lead managed by United Overseas Bank Ltd.
The offer will close on April 7 and trading is expected to begin on a when-issued basis on April 9.
Serial System recorded a group net profit of S$7.4 million for the financial year ended June 30, 1996 on a turnover of S$184.3 million.
